column4: anyone have any clue as to why I can connect to a remote samba server running ubuntu, but it seems no one else can?
no one else on the same network?
it's connections accross the internet, server's in france, I'm in australia and connect fine, there are other people on entirely separate networks who cannot connect. I am not using a VPN etc.
is this your samba server ?
yes
check the smb.allow and smb.config to see if the users are allowed and if there are any ip filters
I can't find an smb.allow file and there doesn't appear to be any IP filters
sorry I meant hosts.allow/hosts.deny
where can I find them?
/etc
both appear to be empty (apart from instructional comments)
are you using a firewall?
maybe the router is also blocking those ips
server. but if the users are on a corporate network it could also be blocking outgoing requests
it's a dedicated machine I'm renting from a server host.... I doubt they'd be filtering smb traffic..
you sure they don't just allow access from your ip?
I wouldn't imagine so, as I installed SMB myself
have a look at the iptables for the server
I assume you're giving another username to these other people?
are you allowing those users in smb.conf
yes, though they never make it to the password prompt; connection refused
that sounds like a firewall problem
I can try and connect from here if you msg me the ip
